intro: Hemibaccharis flexilis, commonly known as flexible woodbine, is a shrub native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its trailing stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant is adapted to moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetland habitats.
